instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3302: What is 820-3302? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: a1418 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
I have a I mac 21.5 with a broken audio jack. Does anybody knows any way of disabling the port to restore the sound at least from the speakers 

thank you

threads.title: a1418 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Don't work on iMacs, But couldn't you just desolder it? Perhaps look into changing the port?

threads.title: a1418 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: try remove <RESISTOR>R6805</RESISTOR> or <RESISTOR>R6806</RESISTOR>. they are headphone and SPDIF detection resistors.

threads.title: a1418 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: You can also use a Kerplunk (or similar) stick and free up the contact inside the jack. Did this on a 17" MBP a while back. It's still working.

threads.title: a1418 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Jacks are not the same as the macbook pro and i cant find a spare parts. Also taking the jack out is not doing anything and there is not <RESISTOR>R6805</RESISTOR> or <RESISTOR>R6806</RESISTOR> 

thanks

threads.title: a1418 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: I don't see the issue here, the audio jack is a separate replaceable part.....not on the board.

threads.title: a1418 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Yes but i cant find a replacement part. no ebay no alibaba.

threads.title: a1418 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
